rComments: One of the best classes I have taken at UCSC.  In ten weeks Selden gets the class through the basic grammar for Middle Egyptian.  By the end of the 10-week quarter we were reading Middle Egyptian literature in the original.

A huge amount of work - too much for one class - in a short amount of time. Expects you to be able to dedicate 5 hours a day to the class - if you are taking more than 1 class, this will be hard for you. Hieroglyphs is not easy to begin with but this class does not serve to teach you anymore than you would gain from just reading the textbook.
A wonderful guy. Years later, I still look back on his class as one of the best. He taught me how to be diligent.

Very intelligent and very knowledgeable on classical history.  His tests can come across as difficult but he is aware of this and grades easily as a result.  He really wants to be thorough in his lectures but he also gets easily sidetracked and goes off on digressions and this can lead to you progressing through class slower than the syllabus says.

An amazing teacher. He gives you his phone number in case you have questions. The course is definitely work-intensive and not for the faint of heart, but if you stick with it, it is amazingly rewarding. A definite recommendation.

Selden has so much history and background and extra information for what he's teaching that it's sometimes overwhelming. At the same time, it shows how brilliant he is. He's a strict grader, but fair. Brings in a lot of interesting relevant outside information and the readings aren't vast, but a little dense. Brilliant professor!

This class required a TON of reading (12 books and 3 course readers) but all of the reading was related and extremely helpful in film analysis. He is the hardest professor I have had so far but also one of the most intelligent people I have ever been in the presence of. I loved going to this class and I love ACTUALLY learning something in a class!

This is by far the toughest professor I have ever had!!  He is vague during his lectures, and requires a TON of reading.  I had to buy $250 worth of books, and still couldn't get 3 of the 12 REQUIRED BOOKS.  The reading is outrageous!!  If this was the one single class you were taking, it might barely be manageable.  He ALWAYS goes over in time.  I
I put a lot of hard work into this course. I got A's and B's on all tests and papers, yet he still gave me an F because I missed two classes. Hmmm... that does not seem fair at all.

This was really one of the best classes I've ever taken. I get the feeling that he lectures best to small groups, because the classroom environment was small and therefore intellectually stimulating. He's a brilliant professor who shows genuine interest, and if you really work hard, it's an easy A. But that's if you put the hours in.

I took Hieroglyphics 1&2 with Selden and he's really interesting. He knows a lot of information and is always willing to share. He knows what he's talking about so listen if you're in his class! Hiero was intense but really rewarding at the end. Plus, everyone gets to be such good friends by Hiero 2 because we all know each other. It's great!
Really nice but really boring....

Very knowledgeable, and the material could have been interesting had the class not met at 8AM. Lectures are nearly impossible to sit through without nodding off for awhile...rather boring...but Selden seems like a good guy.

this guy amazes me...seems incredibly knowledgeable about EVERYTHING, and would love to have a normal conversation with him just to see what gems he throws out at you. but in a huge lecture hall, not so much. reading load was impossible, and attendance was tough for an 8 AM class. material was thought-provoking; would recommend for lit majors.
Great teacher. A lot of reading (just skim). His prompts are challenging and that's a good thing. His large classes are not so engaging, but from what I hear his smaller classes are much better.
he's way better with a small group of people where you can actually have a conversation with him.

He has a trembling voice that makes him sound like he's very nervous all the time, yet somehow he still manages to come off as completely pompous.  He frequently parades his knowledge of Latin in front of the class without real cause-the texts we address are English translations that need little clarification.(slackers:Punctuality/attendance nazi.
No Comments
This man is freakin brilliant.  He has a following of students who got to study under him in a very small class setting, during which we got a good look at how much this man's mind actually holds.

I am writing as a PhD student who took Seldon years ago. I now realize how knowledgable he is. His class is what higher education should be. His class in VERY intellectualy challanging, but what you learn will pay off forever!He is great out of class, even if a bit serious and stiff in class. I think about his lectures all the time, even to ths day

Selden is among my favorite instructors at UCSC. His classes can be very challenging but are always intellectually stimulating. Hieroglyphs is an extremely challenging class, but its also really fun. Selden is a great lecturer, he's easy going, grades relatively easily, and will help you outside of class.
